content.raw:
A couple of interesting things:

* There's a warning for this line but not the one below (which I can't reproduce locally with gcc or clang)
* The proto enum gets converted to a C++ enum in the generated code, and according to the standard "It is implementation-defined which integral type is used as the underlying type for an enumeration", so we shouldn't assume anything.

So I'm just casting them all in 1cdb4a6, hopefully the warning goes away
content.html:
A couple of interesting things:

  • There's a warning for this line but not the one below (which I can't reproduce locally with gcc or clang)
  • The proto enum gets converted to a C++ enum in the generated code, and according to the standard "It is implementation-defined which integral type is used as the underlying type for an enumeration", so we shouldn't assume anything.

So I'm just casting them all in 1cdb4a6, hopefully the warning goes away
